meanings.definition: Arrange in a systematic order or plan.
meanings.sent1: She systematized her closet by color-coding all her clothes.
meanings.sent2: The librarian systematized the books on the shelves by genre.
meanings.sent3: The ants systematized their food storage in a perfectly organized line.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were systematized like a well-structured building.
meanings.sent5: The teacher systematized the lesson plan to make it easier for the students to follow.

meanings.sent1: He systematized his study schedule to include specific time slots for each subject.
meanings.sent2: The manager systematized the workflow to increase efficiency in the office.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels systematized their nut collection in a cleverly designed storage unit.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were systematized into a coherent presentation.
meanings.sent5: The chef systematized the kitchen layout for optimal cooking flow.
